Indications and doses

Prophylaxis and treatment of infection in burn wounds,

To the skin

  • For adults
    Apply daily, may be applied more frequently if very exudative.
  • For children
    Apply daily, may be applied more frequently if very exudative.

For conservative management of finger-tip injuries,

To the skin

  • For adults
    Apply every 2–3 days, consult product literature for details.
  • For children
    Apply every 2–3 days, consult product literature for details.

Adjunct to prophylaxis of infection in skin graft donor sites and extensive abrasions,

To the skin

  • For adults
    (consult product literature).

Adjunct to short-term treatment of infection in pressure sores,

To the skin

  • For adults
    Apply once daily or on alternate days.

As an adjunct to short-term treatment of infection in leg ulcers,

To the skin

  • For adults
    Apply once daily or on alternate days, not recommended if ulcer is very exudative.

Advice when patient is pregnant

Risk of neonatal haemolysis and methaemoglobinaemia in third trimester.

Advice regarding hepatic impairment

Manufacturer advises caution if significant impairment.

Advice regarding renal impairment

Manufacturer advises caution if significant impairment.

Contra indications

  • Not recommended for neonates

Known side effects

General side effects

notKnown: Allergic reactions, argyria (following treatment of large areas of skin or prolonged use), burning, itching, leucopenia, rashes,

Severe blood and skin disorders

Owing to the association of sulfonamides with severe blood and skin disorders, treatment should be stopped immediately if blood disorders or rashes develop.

Leucopenia developing 2–3 days after starting treatment of burns patients is reported usually to be self-limiting and silver sulfadiazine need not usually be discontinued provided blood counts are monitored carefully to ensure return to normality within a few days.

Directions for administration

Apply with sterile applicator.

Cautions regarding administration

  • G6PD deficiency

  • Plasma-sulfadiazine concentrations may approach therapeutic levels with side-effects and interactions as for sulfonamides if large areas of skin are treated.

Monitoring requirements

Patient parameters

Monitor for leucopenia.

Unlicensed use

With topical use in children

No age range specified by manufacturer.

Advice regarding allergies and cross sensitivities

Contra-indicated in patients with sensitivity to sulfonamides.

Prepared medicinal forms of SILVER SULFADIAZINE

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.
